Ruby on Rails Software Engineering Manager ($100K/yr) - Online Hiring Event

Company Name Crossover for Work Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

We're running an Online Hiring Event this Saturday, to hire Ruby on Rails Software Engineering Managers ($100K/yr).

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

The Ruby on Rails Software Engineering Manager will serve as a key member of our global executive team and will be responsible for delivering high-quality products.

This leadership position demands proficiency to conduct tech reviews, improve productivity from your engineering organization and guide a global talented pool of professionals to solve business problems continuously.

We are looking for hands-on leaders with a robust Cloud background, who are comfortable with aggressive weekly targets and have the ability to leverage their technical depth to set the standard for software engineering excellence.

Candidate Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or Ph.D. preferred) is mandatory
  • 10+ years of experience in hands-on software development/engineering
  • 3+ years experience leading software development teams
  • Experience in managing teams of 10+ people
  • At least 3 years of experience working in Cloud, Agile, CI/CD, DevOps environments
  • Hands-on experience in Ruby on Rails architecture and programming
  • Experience in Software Engineering focused instead of product management
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Excellent understanding of current enterprise software technologies and development practices/tools, including virtualization, source control, build and test automation, code quality automation technologies
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity
  • Proficiency in Test Automation, AWS and TDD is desired but not mandatory
  • Demonstrated success as a problem solver, result-oriented, self-starter
  • Comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world - we do a lot of Skype and video conferencing
  • Good proficiency in the English language

System Pre-requisite

These are the recommended and minimum system requirements for participating in the online hiring event.

  • Any IDE

    • Join our community of remote professionals!

    We have over 4,000 Crossover team members and are growing our network around the world.

    Crossover is redefining the way people work. A future where all high-skill jobs go to the cloud and big-data is used to help individuals and teams become more and more productive. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our workforce is global and will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent and are now in over 108 different countries. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing cloud talent. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best people for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Store Manager - Dan Murphy's Warrnambool

Store Manager - Dan Murphy's Warrnambool | Join an unbeatable team

About Dan Murphy’s

When Dan Murphy opened his first liquor store in 1952, he believed in offering the biggest range, the lowest prices and unbeatable customer service. A promise we still pride ourselves on keeping today.

We’re looking for talented, passionate people to help continue his legacy.

If you’re successful, you’ll join our vibrant team in making Dan Murphy’s a world leader in customer service. You’ll enjoy a great company culture, plus access to great employee benefits and training programs. And because Dan Murphy’s is part of Woolworths Group, you’ll be part of Australia’s largest retail group.

Be a part of our market leading liquor operation

Act as a champion of change in this critical position

Dan Murphy’s people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for our customers, our team, our communities and our business then we should connect.

Your track record of leading and managing change coupled with 3 to 5 years of retail management experience will see you be successful in this role. Your energy, edge and love of a fast-paced working environment are also crucial.

 The ability to develop and inspire others

Mechanical Engineer

Company Name APA Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 149 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


  • 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
  • Leading Gas and Pipeline infrastructure company
  • Melbourne, VIC


Bring your energy! APA Group is one of Australia’s leading energy infrastructure businesses. As a part of the APA team, you’ll join a group of passionate professionals who work safely, and responsibly to deliver Australia’s energy.

As one of Australia’s ASX top 50 organisations we offer career and personal development opportunities, work-life balance, discounts, incentives and wellbeing programs.

Best of all, we are a bunch of great people to work with!

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer to join our Infrastructure Development team in Southbank, Melbourne.

Reporting to the Project Engineering Manager, you will play a key role in providing Mechanical Engineering design support, design consultant liaison, technical document preparation and review, and package engineering services in support of the delivery of APA Major Capital Works Program.

  • Co-ordinate with Engineering Manager – Design to ensure the delivery of fit-for-purpose and reliable mechanical engineering designs consistent with Project requirements and APA standards;
  • Review and approval (as delegated) mechanical design calculations, reports, documentation and drawings prepared by the Principal Engineering Design Consultant.
  • Work with the Engineering Manager to ensure adequate and appropriate engineering resources are available to meet technical and schedule requirements.
  • Interface with key stakeholders including Operations, AM&E, and Major Projects in order to expedite project process;
  • Provide engineering support during construction, commissioning and handover to operations
  • Provide input, as required to continuously improve relevant engineering standards, policies and procedures relating to project engineering


To excel in this position you will have the following skills, experience, qualifications and attributes:

  • Proven experience in the design, construction, operation or maintenance of gas transmission assets
  • Proven skills in project planning, budgeting, estimating and cost control.
  • Planning and meeting deadlines in performing project work, cost analysis and technical reports.
  • Experience in development functional designs, detailed design input and final review
  • Advise during construction an on behalf of the asset owner for new or modified pipelines, plant and equipment added to the asset base and prepare construction, commissioning and operational documentation for gas transmission assets
  • With a strong focus on achieving results, a collaborative working style and a values-based culture, APA offers you a career opportunity like no other!


If this sounds like a company and team that you’d like to be a part of we’d love to hear from you! Submit your application (covering letter and CV) by pressing the “Apply” button below before the closing date of 9 October 2018.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

Industry

  • Oil & Energy

Contract

Talent and Sourcing Business Partner - Major Projects
Job ID: 554052
Job type: Full Time - Fixed Term
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Human Resources

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Downer has over 100 years’ experience delivering total rail asset solutions for its passenger and freight customers. We have an extensive national footprint with approximately 20 sites across Australia.

Position Summary

To support increased resourcing demand and growth across our Major Projects business, we are now expanding our internal recruitment team with the addition of a Talent & Sourcing Business Partner to join our Melbourne CBD office. This role will support a defined client group that is largely involved in delivering rail rolling stock and large-scale PPP projects.

As the Talent & Sourcing Business Partner, you will play an integral part of our Major Projects business and you will be a trusted and well-regarded member of a wider recruitment team that holds a great deal of expertise and knowledge. We’re seeking engaging individuals who have the ability to understand the needs of our hiring managers and deliver tailored sourcing solutions that meet the needs of the business. Pivotal to this role will be your ability to develop strong stakeholder relationships in order to deliver timely sourcing needs across both white and blue-collar environments.

This role is being offered initially as a fixed-term contract with the potential to transition into a permanent role.

About You
  • A specialist with end-to-end recruitment experience, ideally from a similar multi-disciplined organisation, or alternatively agency experience delivering to client groups across the manufacturing, heavy engineering or construction industries.
  • The ability to manage multiple stakeholder relationships and build rapport.
  • Sound search methodologies and ability to think outside the box to engage and identify the right candidates.
  • Highly effective communication style teamed with strong inter-personal and influencing skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to use applicant tracking systems such as Page Up coupled with Linkedin Recruiter experience.


What We Offer
  • An opportunity to work for a major ASX listed company and be exposed to gaining recruitment experience across large-scale and high-profile projects.
  • The ability to build your professional career in a multi-disciplined business environment.
  • A supportive and dynamic team environment.


How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply button.

For more information please contact: Clarissa Esteller – Talent & Sourcing Lead, Major Projects

E: clarissa.esteller@downergroup.com (Please note that applications will not be accepted via email. Please submit your application via the advertisement).

How To Apply

To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply now button

Closing Date: 05 Oct 2018 AUS Eastern Standard Time

Civil Estimating Manager

Company Name CPB Contractors Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Reporting to the Chief Estimator, you will contribute to the effective delivery of estimating services through the professional preparation, competitive pricing and on-time delivery of tenders to maximise the probability of securing profitable construction contracts.
CPB Contractors is a leading international construction company and a member of the CIMIC Group.

We combine the construction track record and expertise formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, and we also include the people and projects of Leighton Asia.

In conjunction with our clients and partners, CPB Contractors is delivering important and iconic projects across all key sectors of the construction industry, meaning we offer significant and diverse work opportunities.

We are building on the strong foundations of our unique history to create a successful and sustainable future. Safely delivering next-generation infrastructure that better connects people and transforms communities is at the heart of what we do.

What can our construction projects build for you?

Your opportunity

Reporting to the Chief Estimator, you will contribute to the effective delivery of estimating services through the professional preparation, competitive pricing and on-time delivery of tenders to maximise the probability of securing profitable construction contracts.

As a Civil Estimating Manager, you will be accountable for:
  • Planning and sequencing work packages using sound civil construction and project management methodology, considering available resources and expertise, client requirements, and profit targets
  • Estimating types and quantities of materials and labour required for delivery of each work package
  • Providing leadership to a team of Estimators
  • Calculating total materials, labour, indirect and overhead costs for each work package to meet client’s requirements and maximise profit


Our Minimum Requirements For This Role Are
  • You have a minimum of 10 years construction experience in a commercial or supervisory role.
  • You have 10 years of experience in the estimation of large construction projects on a senior level.
  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Building, Construction or equivalent
  • An ability to work as part of a large bid team.
  • The flexibility to occasionally travel interstate to work on tenders.

If you are interested in these roles and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

We support diversity in the workplace. Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.

Please note: This role is being sourced through CPB Contractors directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

Industry

  • Civil Engineering
  • Staffing and Recruiting

Full-time

Head of Hospitality and Customer Experience - Chadstone Shopping Centre

Company Name Vicinity Centres Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We exist to enrich community experiences. We reimagine destinations of the future, creating places where people love to connect. We do this by creating unique and relevant consumer experiences, delivering compelling value to our retail partners and striving for excellence in everything we do.
 Role purpose The key purpose of the Head of Hospitality and Customer Experience is to develop and lead the strategic hospitality and customer experience direction of Chadstone Shopping Centre, including but not limited to, supporting its hotel partner, developing a clear whole of site customer experience, and working collaboratively with stakeholders to deliver true value relevant to a world-class asset. Specifically, this role is required to develop and shape the customer experience strategy across the evolving requirements of the precinct including Chadstone Hotel, the commercial towers and the retail shopping experience. You will act as the primary relationship manager for Chadstone Hotel and will ensure that the operators are delivering across the key deliverables within the hotel management agreement. Lastly, you will nurture a culture of adaptability and responsiveness within the team and provide opportunities to build capability. What will you bring?
This role forms an important part of the Chadstone leadership team and requires strong financial acumen, communication and leadership skills. You will be a senior manager in hotel, tourism and hospitality operations (General Manager level) with experience developing CX strategies that lead to outstanding CX outcomes with exposure and experience in the management of the pre-opening of a hotel environment. Your leadership capability will extend to developing and implementing strategic hotel operating plans, CX strategies and developing key relationships that lead to tourism partnership opportunities. You will have designed and delivered strategic direction by keeping abreast of industry innovations, trends, performance and insights; your excellent influencing and negotiation skills will give you the ability to gain stakeholder support across all levels of the organisation, quickly and with ease. A relevant business qualification is desirable.
What will success look like?
We Imagine a Better Way

  • You redefine and establish industry best standards for customer service and explore and pilot innovative approaches to the way CX operates and adds value to the business, new markets and product development
  • You demonstrate a strong commitment to continuous improvement and innovative ideas that translate to successful commercial outcomes
  • You have the curiosity and courage to trial new ways, technology and approaches, and can apply a ‘fail fast, learn quickly, and move forward’ mentality
We Embrace Difference

  • You proactively seek out diverse views and adopt them to the Chadstone Strategy to make better business decisions
  • You influence and support diversity, challenge assumptions and foster a capable flexible working environment
  • You are a trusted advisor and leader with the ability to involve and inspire others
We Always Collaborate

  • You proactively manage and communicate with internal and external stakeholders (customers, owners, and retailers alike) to ensure buy-in and advocacy from all stakeholders
  • You lead and inspire a team of hospitality, tourism and customer service professionals in the achievement of agreed targets and objectives
  • You engage with others to develop a whole of site customer experience strategy to enhance the customer/guest experience at Chadstone to lead to increased frequency of visit and brand advocacy
Why Vicinity?
At Vicinity, we are in the business of people. The people who shop in our centres, lease our retail space, invest in our centres, and of course, the people who work in and for our centres and our corporate office. Our people are important, and we believe in giving them every opportunity to grow and succeed in our business.

Our benefits program focuses on creating an awesome place to work in which our people are rewarded and recognised, and offers flexibility, balance and continuous learning opportunities, ensuring we give back, and that we look after ourselves.

Our values cultivate a culture that encourages our 1300+ team members to be curious, agile, passionate and committed. At Vicinity we embrace difference. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that supports diversity and flexibility.

 Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing, relevant Australian work rights. At the later stages of the recruitment process the shortlisted candidate/candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal History Background/Police Check as a mandatory part of the process. Additional qualification checks may also be required dependant on role and level.

Senior Marketing Manager

Company Name carsales.com.au Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 129 views

Job description

  • 12-month fixed-term contract
  • WGEA employer of choice
  • Join the team at Australia's number 1 car sales website

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.

In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The role

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Marketing Manager to join us on a 12-month fixed-term contract. You will champion the development and execution of a holistic trade communication strategy for carsales.com Ltd. Joining the fast-paced centralised marketing team, you’ll find no two days are the same with exposure to senior stakeholders across the business a key component of this role. You’ll be leading a team of 6 and as a confident people leader, you will have experience developing high performing teams. You will mentor, coach and develop your team to become trusted marketing experts in the business.

You will be a strategic thinker, able to drive and develop a coordinated content and event program. You will develop strong stakeholder relationships and use your experience to influence the trade marketing strategy. You will be responsible for building a trade marketing plan that enables our commercial team to effectively communicate our broad range of advertising, software and service solutions and most importantly deliver on their objectives.

What You’ll Do
  • Using your expert marketing knowledge, develop a strategic plan for trade products and services.
  • Inspire, develop and manage a team, leading them to become trusted experts in marketing for the business.
  • Develop and manage acquisition and retention strategies for trade products & services and customer lifecycle management.
  • Work closely with senior stakeholders across the business, using your skills and experience to influence campaign development and delivery.
  • Actively work with as external agencies to develop and manage brand & creative for all environments.
  • Develop communication strategies for senior business stakeholders around marketing performance and budgets.
  • Build a best in class digital product collateral and media centre for all trade offerings.
  • Act as a brand owner to ensure all messaging and communication accurately reflects our brand and point of difference.


What We're Looking For
  • Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in business management or marketing.
  • Exceptional leadership skills that inspire, develop and retain a high performing team.
  • Extensive exposure to senior stakeholder management.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced marketing environment.
  • Exposure to segmented marketing in below the line channels.
  • Ability to work on up to 15 campaigns at any given time.
  • Demonstrated resolution and negotiation skills.
  • Demonstrated experience managing and supporting a team.
  • Outstanding attention to detail, with the ability to juggle competing priorities and manage time accordingly

Why Apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance and reward, and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply!

--

Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.
